intro: Myosotis joannae, commonly known as the New Zealand forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the genus Myosotis in the family Boraginaceae, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Myosotis joannae is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
